intro: Hieracium subnoetoii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, with a hairy texture, and its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Hieracium subnoetoii is often found in rocky or gravelly areas and is adapted to withstand cold and harsh environmental conditions.
